result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon Hoover Sensenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted credit for 208 days served.  Court found defendant to be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Buy money reimbursement to West Central Drug Task Force

Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.
Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.
Defendant is ordered to sign all releases for information as requested by the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  
The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforment official without cause .  
The defendant shall have no contact with Trent Kroening, Caleb Quelle, Ashley Moore, or Kenneth Eisenhuth  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Additionally, at the time of required meetings with the agent, defendant is to provide a list of persons he is spending significant time with so that the agent can provide guidance as to the advisability of maintaining that contact.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Marquette County case 12-CF-34, Count 1, Possession with intent to deliver Heroin, PTAC, 961.41(1m)(d)3; Count 2, Possession of THC, PTAC, 961.41(3g)(e); Count 3 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, 961.573(1) was read-in to this case by stipulation of the parties.
